dict.string: In iOS, the Exchange payload is designated by specifying com.apple.eas.account as the PayloadType value. This payload configures an Exchange Active Sync Contacts account on the device. Mail and Calendar are not config- ured using this payload on iOS.
As with VPN and Wi-Fi configurations, it is possible to associate an SCEP credential with an Exchange configu- ration via the PayloadCertificateUUID key.
Optional. A human-readable description of this payload. This description is shown on the Detail screen.
The display name for the account.
A human-readable name for the profile payload. This name is displayed on the Detail screen. It does not have to be unique.
A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited. Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier.
A reverse-DNS-style identifier for the specific payload. It is usually the same identifier as the root-level PayloadIdentifier value with an additional component appended.
The type of the payload, a reverse dns string.
A globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but it must be globally unique. In macOS, you can use uuidgen to generate reasonable UUIDs.
The version of the whole configuration profile.

The version number of the individual payload. A profile can consist of payloads with different version numbers. For example, changes to the VPN software in iOS might introduce a new payload version to support additional features, but Mail payload versions would not necessarily change in the same release.
This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user.

Optional. A human-readable string containing the name of the organization that provided the profile. The payload organization for a payload need not match the payload organization in the enclosing profile.
The user name with the optional domain (e.g "user" or "domain\user").
This string specifies the user name for this Exchange account. Required in macOS or non-interactive installations (like MDM on iOS).
The email address for the account (e.g. "john@company.com).
Specifies the full email address for the account. If not present in the payload, the device prompts for this string during profile installation. In macOS, this key is required.
The password of the user account.
Optional. The password of the account. Use only with encrypted profiles.
If true, a previously set EAS password is overriden with a new password in this payload.
The IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the internal Exchange host.
Specifies the Exchange server host name (or IP address). In macOS 10.11 and later, this key is optional.
Send all communication through Secure Socket Layer.
Optional. Default YES. Specifies whether the Exchange server uses SSL for authentication.
Use SSL for Internal Exchange Host
Specifies whether the connection should use OAuth for authentication.

Optional. Specifies whether the connection should use OAuth for authentication. If enabled, a password should not be specified. This defaults to false. Availability: Available only in iOS 12.0 and macOS 10.14 and later.
X.509 certificate (.p12) for inclusion on device.
Optional. For accounts that allow authentication via certificate, a .p12 identity certificate in NSData blob format.
Name or description of the certificate credential.
Optional. Specifies the name or description of the certificate.
Optional. The password necessary for the p12 identity certificate. Used with mandatory encryption of profiles.
If set to true, messages may not be moved out of this email account into another account. Also prevents forwarding or replying from a different account than the message was originated from.

Optional. Defaultfalse. If set to true, messages may not be moved out of this email account into another account. Also prevents forwarding or replying from a different account than the message was originated from. Availability: Available in iOS 5.0 and later.
If set to true, this account will not be available for sending mail in any app other than the Apple Mail app.
Optional. Default false. If set to true, this account will not be available for sending mail in any app other than the Apple Mail app. Availability: Available in iOS 5.0 and later.
UUID of the certificate payload to use for the identity credential.
UUID of the certificate payload to use for the identity credential. If this field is present, the Certificate field is not used. Availability: Available in iOS 5.0 and later.
If true, this account supports S/MIME.
Optional. Default false. If true, this account supports S/MIME. As of iOS 10.0, this key is ignored. Availability: Available only in iOS 5.0 through 9.3.3.
If set to true, S/MIME signing is enabled for this account.
Optional. Default true. If set to true, S/MIME signing is enabled for this account. Availability: Available only in iOS 10.3 and later.
The PayloadUUID of the identity certificate used to sign messages sent from this account.
Optional. The PayloadUUID of the identity certificate used to sign messages sent from this account. Availability: Available only in iOS 5.0 and later.
If set to true, S/MIME encryption is on by default for this account. As of iOS 12.0, this key is deprecated. It is recommended to use SMIMEEncryptByDefault instead.

Optional. Default false. If set to true, S/MIME encryption is on by default for this account. Availability: Available only in iOS 10.3 and later. As of iOS 12.0, this key is deprecated. It is recommended to use SMIMEEncryptByDefault instead.
The PayloadUUID of the identity certificate used to decrypt messages sent to this account.

Optional. The PayloadUUID of the identity certificate used to decrypt messages sent to this account. The public certificate is attached to outgoing mail to allow encrypted mail to be sent to this user. When the user sends encrypted mail, the public certificate is used to encrypt the copy of the mail in their Sent mailbox. Availability: Available only in iOS 5.0 and later.
If set to true, displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI. As of iOS 12.0, this key is deprecated. It is recommended to use SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch instead.

Optional. Default false. If set to true, displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI. Availability: Available only in iOS 8.0 and later. As of iOS 12.0, this key is deprecated. It is recommended to use SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch instead.
If set to true, the user can toggle S/MIME signing on or off in Settings.
Optional. Default false. If set to true, the user can toggle S/MIME signing on or off in Settings. Availability: Available only in iOS 12.0 and later.
Allow user to toggle S/MIME Signing
If set to true, the user can select the signing identity.
Optional. Default false. If set to true, the user can select the signing identity. Availability: Available only in iOS 12.0 and later.
Allow user to select S/MIME Identity
If set to true, S/MIME encryption is enabled by default.

Optional. Default false. If set to true, S/MIME encryption is enabled by default. If SMIMEEnableEncryptionPerMessageSwitch is false, this default cannot be changed by the user. Availability: Available only in iOS 12.0 and later.
If set to true, the user can toggle the encryption by default setting.
Optional. Default false. If set to true, the user can toggle the encryption by default setting. Availability: Available only in iOS 12.0 and later.
Allow user to select S/MIME Encryption
If set to true, the user can select the S/MIME encryption identity and encryption is enabled.
Optional. Default false. If set to true, the user can select the S/MIME encryption identity and encryption is enabled. Availability: Available only in iOS 12.0 and later.
Allow user to select S/MIME Encryption Certificate
If set to true, displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI.
Optional. Default false. If set to true, displays the per-message encryption switch in the Mail Compose UI. Availability: Available only in iOS 12.0 and later.
Allow user to select S/MIME Encryption per message
Enables/disables the Calendars service for this account.
If false, disables the Calendars service for this account. The Calendars service may be re-enabled in Settings unless EnableCalendarsUserOverridable is false.
EnableMail, EnableContacts, EnableCalendars, EnableReminders, and EnableNotes can't all be set to false. At least 1 must be enabled.
Enables/disables the Contacts service for this account.
If false, disables the Contacts service for this account. The Contacts service may be re-enabled in Settings unless EnableContactsUserOverridable is false.
EnableMail, EnableContacts, EnableCalendars, EnableReminders, and EnableNotes can't all be set to false. At least 1 must be enabled.
Enables/disables the Mail service for this account.
If false, disables the Mail service for this account. The Mail service may be re-enabled in Settings unless EnableMailUserOverridable is false.
EnableMail, EnableContacts, EnableCalendars, EnableReminders, and EnableNotes can't all be set to false. At least 1 must be enabled.
Enables/disables the Notes service for this account.
If false, disables the Notes service for this account. The Notes service may be re-enabled in Settings unless EnableNotesUserOverridable is false.
EnableMail, EnableContacts, EnableCalendars, EnableReminders, and EnableNotes can't all be set to false. At least 1 must be enabled.
Enables/disables the Reminders service for this account.
If false, disables the Reminders service for this account. The Reminders service may be re-enabled in Settings unless EnableRemindersUserOverridable is false.
EnableMail, EnableContacts, EnableCalendars, EnableReminders, and EnableNotes can't all be set to false. At least 1 must be enabled.
Enables/disables the users to modify the Calendars settings.
If false, prevents the user from changing the state of the Calendars service for this account in Settings.
Enables/disables the users to modify the Contacts settings.
If false, prevents the user from changing the state of the Contacts service for this account in Settings.
Enables/disables the users to modify the Mail settings.
If false, prevents the user from changing the state of the Mail service for this account in Settings.
Enables/disables the users to modify the Notes settings.
If false, prevents the user from changing the state of the Notes service for this account in Settings.
Enables/disables the users to modify the Reminders settings.
If false, prevents the user from changing the state of the Reminders service for this account in Settings.
If true, this account is excluded from address Recents syncing.
If true, this account is excluded from address Recents syncing. This defaults to false. Availability: Available only in iOS 6.0 and later.
Exclude this account from address recents syncing
The number of days since synchronization.
The number of days since synchronization.

The No Limit option is only mentioned in https://support.apple.com/en-al/guide/deployment/depa9c22f8c/web. No value is given for it in the document, however a value of zero was provided by a user of the manifest who tested it to work.
The communication service handler rules for this account.

Optional. The communication service handler rules for this account. The CommunicationServiceRules dictionary currently contains only a DefaultServiceHandlers key; its value is a dictionary which contains an AudioCall key whose value is a string containing the bundle identifier for the default application that handles audio calls made to contacts from this account.
Bundle identifier for the default application that handles audio calls made to contacts from this account
UUID of a per-app VPN payload to tunnel this account communication through
